meanings.definition: Move in an exaggeratedly impatient or angry manner.
meanings.sent1: She flounced out of the room when she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: The child flounced around the store, upset that they couldn't buy a toy.
meanings.sent3: He flounced out of the meeting, causing everyone to chuckle at his dramatic exit.
meanings.sent4: The cat flounced away from the dog, tail held high in defiance.
meanings.sent5: The student flounced into the classroom, slamming the door behind them.

meanings.definition: A strip of decorative gathered or pleated material attached to a garment.
meanings.sent1: The dress had a beautiful flounced hem that swayed as she walked.
meanings.sent2: She added a flounced trim to the curtains to give them a more elegant look.
meanings.sent3: The flounced edge of the tablecloth caught the sunlight, creating a lovely effect.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's skirt had multiple layers of flounced fabric that twirled gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The costume designer carefully sewed the flounced ruffle onto the collar of the shirt.
